intro: Trigonotis muliensis var. muliensis, commonly known as the Yunnan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has lanceolate leaves with a hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
